runs.comm: back of a length outside off stump, Lumb pushes it square off the back foot to get England underway
comes across the stumps and works this from outside off to infront of square
keeping it back of a length, Hales aims an expansive pull but doesn't make contact...nothing pitched up so far
there's the first full one, and it's a good response from McClenaghan as Hales came down the pitch and he fired it wider outside off
heaved away through square leg, stand-and-deliver from Hales, and it goes straight to deep square
swings down the leg side and beats a diving Brendon McCullum so that's a bonus for England...that started outside leg stump
he adjusts well, goes full outside off, driven to the covers
slugged through the leg side with a lot of bottom hand, takes it from outside off into midwicket
massive! The first six of the evening and it's over the longest part of the ground. Dropped in short and Hales pulls it off the front foot over deep midwicket
starts to shimmy down the pitch and Boult pushes it wider outside off
swings into the pads, cramps Hales for room as he tries to clip to leg
down the pitch again, driven firmly square of the wicket and there's nearly a mix-up but the throw misses at Hales' end
no holding back, Lumb uses his feet and tries to drive through the off side but gets beaten by the full delivery
short of a length outside off, no timing as goes for the pull and it dribbles towards square leg
sweetly struck, drills this full delivery through the off side...a free flow of the arms through the ball
goes full at the stumps, swings into the pads a touch and it's clipped with good timing to deep square
short ball, first proper bouncer of the evening, and he beats Lumb's rather half-hearted attempt to paddle it around the corner
a lot of swinging with not much reward at the moment for Lumb as he fails to make contact with another booming drive
comes down the pitch straight away outside leg and squirts to the off side
fired in at the feet, he can only dig it out back to the bowler...a 'crowd catch'
there's the short boundaries, Hales drives this past a diving mid-on and it's over the ropes in the blink of an eye

well bowled, holds this one back, it's a fraction slower, Hales comes down the pitch but loses his shape as he aims over the leg side and McCullum completes a neat stumping. Spin works, as it often does
fraction of width outside off, cut away to backward point
floated onto leg stump, worked out to deep square-leg
full outside off, driven without much timing to the covers
good delivery, full and swings back into Wright who can only drive off a thick inside edge back towards the bowler
ping...this time he connects cleanly and lofts another full delivery straight down the ground
drags the length back a touch and beats Wright's swing, then gets away with a marginal wide call
not sure that really came out of the middle, but it clears the deep midwicket boundary comfortably...Wright was able to get underneath this delivery
low full toss, Wright was shuffling all around the crease as it was delivered and ends up clubbing it to mid-on
gives himself room by going outside leg, exposes all the stumps, and drives to cover
that's a lovely shot, classy in whatever format, as he keeps his shape while using his feet then lofts it over mid-off with a straight bat
this one is a little more agricultural but very effective as he takes it from outside off straight past mid-on
squeezed into the off side
that's well played by Lumb because he was nearly beaten as Hira bowled it a touch slower, but he went through with his paddle sweep and got it backward of square on the leg side
just a chip, barely anything more, and it sails over long-on...big over for England to end the Powerplay
short of a length, tucked out to deep square
slides into Lumb and takes the pad, big appeal from the B version of McCullum but it was going down leg
fired in full and flat, pushed down the ground to long-on
clever stuff from McCullum who saw Wright coming down the pitch, he fired it wide outside leg and Wright did really well to kick away
another one straight down the ground, a comfortable swing through the line from Wright and anything close to the middle sails away
dropped, this is driven firmly towards cover but he can't hold on...Ross Taylor the man
back of a length and pulled to deep square-leg
lovely shot, it's a day to be a batsmen...full on off stump and just leans into what was really a gentle lofted drive and it's well into the stands
dropped, another one down! And it's Ross Taylor again. A slower ball from Ellis, nicely bowled, Lumb chips it very high towards deep midwicket so Taylor had plenty of time but made a mess of it
it's hard to keep up...dropped in short, Wright throws all his weight into a pull and gets a top edge over the keeper
huge! That's big on any ground. Not the right length, allowing Wright to underneath the ball and he launches it over a straight midwicket
gone! This time they hold one. A little fortunate for New Zealand as it was another length ball, Wright connected cleanly but slotted it straight to deep midwicket
resumes full on middle and off, 136kph, flicked out to deep square
a full delivery, pushed into the off side
swing and a miss to a full delivery outside off, Lumb was aiming through the leg side
good piece of bowling, banged in a short and Lumb went for the pull but it loops off the glove could to send a simple catch to short fine-leg
good length on off stump, Bairstow pushes his first ball square to point
dropped in short again, Bairstow picks it up early pulls well in front of square...not much time reassess when wickets fall, just have to keep going
starts with a low full toss outside off and it's driven down the ground...odd field, no mid-off who is almost cover instead
no effort needed on this one, just leans on it and bunts down the ground
drags the length back a fraction and Morgan pushes to cover
beaten by one that swings away outside off stump
decent comeback from Franklin, back of a length and it's defended towards cover
it's like a shooting gallery as Franklin goes fuller which gives Morgan the chance to drive through the line and these batsmen will always be confident of clearing the straight boundaries
reverse sweep to a delivery on the stumps, well struck but straight to short third man
ensures he doesn't get too full, Morgan plays to the off side
nicely bowled, follows Morgan as he tries to give himself some room and he just pushes down to long-on which isn't much further back than mid-on
played back to the bowler
for a second there was a question whether this was clean enough...soon became clear it was as Bairstow goes over long-on
flatter on leg stump, worked out to deep midwicket
that's a freebie from Ellis as he drops short on leg stump, Bairstow swivels on the pull and with barely any effort gets another six
blimey, it's a tough game for the bowler...Bairstow aims through the leg side and gets a inside edge past the stumps. Was actually a good slower ball. No reward
back of a length at off stump, Bairstow gives himself a touch of room and drives to Taylor at cover
round the wicket, short of a length, pulled into the square-leg area
bouncer which slides down the leg side and it's called wide
dropped, this was a really tough one - third drop of the innings. Bairstow pulled out to deep square, Hira made good ground but couldn't take a low chance
on leg stump, chipped in the air and carries quite a way but falls short of deep square
back of a length, Morgan opens the face and drops it backward of point
well bowled, back of a length, Bairstow doesn't make contact with his short-arm-jab turned pull
goes full and it's work along the ground through midwicket...there's some excellent running to make that into a two, even they are rare on this ground
a slower bouncer which Bairstow waits for then ramps it at the last minute down to third man
all the way...again. Loses his line a little onto leg stump and Morgan picked it up over the fine-leg boundary. A drop in the crowd
low full toss outside off, driven firmly but straight to deep cover
round the wicket, fired in full, driven down to long-off
flicked down to long on
poor line down the leg side, tickled away very fine...can't afford to be on the pads
he gets away with this as he chips into the gap...Morgan tried to go over the off side and it skewed off  a thick edge
drilled down to long-off, a metre either side and that was four
played out to deep cover

dropped Oh my goodness, New Zealand having a nightmare in the field. Morgan drives and gets a thick outside towards short third man where it just goes through McClenaghan's hands...blinks is eyes as though he didn't pick it up
now that hurts for the bowler, gets lofted over deep square leg the ball after the dropped chance
pushed into the off side
excellent piece of fielding at cover as Hira dives to cut off Bairstow's back-foot drive which was well timed
fired in full and wide, well bowled, and Morgan plays over the top of it. DOT BALL.
angled into Morgan from round the wicket and he just drops it into the covers to keep the strike
round the wicket, uses his feet and nudges down the ground
low full toss and it's just drilled down the ground...Bairstow didn't even really start running
good response from Hira, fired in at Bairstow's pads and he clips to deep midwicket
very good, full on middle, driven straight back to Hira in his follow through
Taylor holds one! And has a wry smile about it. Morgan loses his shape as he tries a booming drive and the ball loops to cover
worked along the ground through midwicket
full at the stumps, pushed reasonably gentle down to long-on
beaten outside off as he aims square
this is almost a bit silly, Buttler virtually mis-hits this off the back foot but manages to pull a six over long-on
big...and bigger. But again it wasn't out of the middle. Almost went straight up but still ended in the second tier of the stand
wonderful shot. A skimmer over extra cover, there was a touch of class about that as he adjusted his wrists at the last minute to pick his spot
nudged into the off side
there's his first attempt at the scoop for the innings and he misses out, which is rare
excellent delivery, full at the stumps and Buttler can only club it through midwicket
pulled to deep square-leg
gives himself room to leg, it's a back-of-a-length delivery, Buttler heaves down to long-on
well, that's a rare sight today. A ball fails to clear long-on. Back of a length again, Bairstow played another flat-batted pull and found Guptill with precision
moves away to leg straight away, it's a short ball and Patel slices it in the air towards deep cover but it falls short
he follows Patel who started moving to leg early, the ball ends up skewing off a thick edge to deep square
full on leg stump, sweetly flicked but straight to deep midwicket
good catch from the captain. Patel gets a big top edge as he aims over the leg side, goes straight up and McCullum moves around from his position to take the chance
full toss outside off stump, nearly beats Buttler who gave himself room but manages get it towards cover
another excellent slower short ball, completely beats Broad's attempt to paddle it around the corner

close! Almost from Franklin. Broad lofted a full ball towards long-on where Franklin runs around the boundary, knows he is close to the rope and that puts him off and he can't stop the boundary either. Technically another drop
good delivery, full at leg stump, Buttler can only get it down the ground for a single
oh, well done Brendon. That was superb. This time it's Broad who gets a big top edge and it goes straight behind McCullum who turns and chases it. Almost goes to far, in fact, but holds on
well bowled, beats him with a full one outside off
another dot ball, good over for New Zealand...full outside off and he tries one of his scoops over third man and can't make contact
that's a clean hit...Boult dropped it in too short, gave Buttler the length he wanted and he launches over long-on
comes round the wicket, full delivery, wonderful drive past mid-off...and it's a no-ball! So a free hit to come. Big bonus for England
it's a good slower ball for the free hit and Buttler gets bowled, but it won't count
